thread.title: Gators QB Will Grier battling illness, may not play against Ole Miss
thread.title_full: Gators QB Will Grier battling illness, may not play against Ole Miss

author: Edgar Thompson, Iliana Limón Romero
title: Gators QB Will Grier battling illness, may not play against Ole Miss
text:
Gators QB Will Grier battling illness, may not play against Ole Miss Florida vs. Tennessee Stephen M. Dowell / Orlando Sentinel Florida head coach Jim McElwain talks to quarterback Will Grier (7) during the Tennessee at Florida college football game at Ben Hill Griffin Stadium in Gainesville on Saturday, September 26, 2015. Florida won 28-27 after a fourth quarter come-from-behind touchdown. ( Stephen M. Dowell/Orlando Sentinel) Florida head coach Jim McElwain talks to quarterback Will Grier (7) during the Tennessee at Florida college football game at Ben Hill Griffin Stadium in Gainesville on Saturday, September 26, 2015. Florida won 28-27 after a fourth quarter come-from-behind touchdown. ( Stephen M. Dowell/Orlando Sentinel) (Stephen M. Dowell / Orlando Sentinel) Edgar Thompson and Iliana Limón Romero Contact Reporters Orlando Sentinel UF QB Will Grier will be a game-time decision against Ole Miss due to an illness 
UF starting quarterback Will Grier is a game-time decision for the No. 25 Gators’ key SEC showdown against No. 3 Ole Miss due to an illness. 
One week removed from leading Florida’s come-back win over Tennessee, it's unclear whether Grier will be healthy enough to take the field against the Rebels, a source close to the program confirmed to the Orlando Sentinel. 
A flu bug has hit the Gators this week, but Grier may not be suffering from the illness and is being monitored by UF athletic trainers leading up the 7 p.m. kickoff Saturday. 
If Grier can't play, Treon Harris is expected to start for Florida. 
Harris missed the Tennessee game due to a one-game suspension. 
Before the health issue, McElwain planned to start Grier and use Harris as a change-of-pace option if needed during the contest.
